quotes.quote: Marriage is a three-ring circus. First the engagement ring, the the wedding ring, then the suffering.
Never get married in the morning, because you never know who you'll meet that night.
The most important four words for a successful marriage: â€˜I'll do the dishes.'
Marriage is a workshopâ€¦ where husband works and wife shops.
Why do married people live longer than single people? I think it's because married people make a special effort to live longer than their partner â€“ just so they can have the last word.
Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
The secret of a happy marriage remainsâ€¦ a secret.
Marriage is like a deck of cards. In the beginning all you need is two hearts and a diamond. By the end, you wish you had a club and a spade.
The bonds of matrimony are like any other bonds â€“ they mature slowly.
Marriage: A legal or religious ceremony by which two persons of the opposite sex solemnly agree to harass and spy on each other for ninety-nine years, or until death do them join.
Marriage is just a fancy word for adopting an overgrown male child who cannot be handled by his parents anymore.
Marriage has no guarantees. If that's what you're looking for, go live with a car battery.
Marriages don't work when one partner is happy and the other is miserable. Marriage is about both people being equally miserable.
They say marriages are made in heaven, but so is thunder and lightning.
A good marriage is like a casserole: only those responsible for it really know what goes in it.
Marriage: It's an agreement in which a man loses his bachelor degree and a woman gains her masters.
Marriage lets you annoy one special person for the rest of your life.
Marriage is a relationship in which one person is always right and the other is the husband!
A man is incomplete until he is married. After that, he is finished.
Marriage is nature's way of ensuring that a woman picks up some mothering experience before she has her first child.
By all means marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy. If you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.
A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
Marriage is just a fancy word for adopting an overgrown male child who cannot be handled by his parents anymore.
Always get married in the morning. That way if it doesn't work out, you haven't wasted the whole day.
All marriages are happy. It's the living together afterward that causes all the trouble.
Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.
Marrying a man is like buying something you've been admiring for a long time in a shop window. You may love it when you get it home, but it doesn't always go with everything else in the house.
Spouse: someone who'll stand by you through all the trouble you wouldn't have had if you'd stayed single.
I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
The longest sentence you can form with two words is: I do.
Engagement marks the end of a whirlwind romance and beginning of an eternal love story.
The highest happiness on earth is marriage.
Grow old with me! The best is yet to be.
When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
I couldn’t have dreamed you into existence because I didn’t even know I needed you. You must have been sent to me.
True love stories never have endings.
Chains do not hold marriage together. It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads which sew people together through the years.
And I’d choose you; in a hundred lifetimes, in a hundred worlds, in any version of reality, I’d find you and I’d choose you.
We have the greatest pre-nuptial agreement in the world. It’s called love.
All commands from your lips are sweet, I say, and now have you not said the sweetest of all? Marry you!
Marriages aren't fireproof. Sometimes you get burned.
For you I make the promise of fidelity / Now and for eternity / No one could replace this vow / For you I'd take your hand and heart / And everything / And add to them a wedding ring
It's a beautiful night / We're looking for something dumb to do / Hey baby / I think I wanna marry you
Is it the look in your eyes / Or is it this dancing juice? / Who cares baby / I think I wanna marry you
A great engagement doesn't just happen-you make it happen by setting realistic goal and then working hard to achieve them.
Many couples enter engagement with already stressed family relationships.
Having a great engagement in those months before you get marries could be compared to having a great pregnancy before you become parents.
Transitional times are stressful, but having a great engagement can lead to a great marriage.
Spend time reminding yourself of your goal to enjoy this engagement process, minimize external stress, and cherish your fiance.
If you want a great engagement, set appropriate physical boundaries, get into accountability groups or same-sex friendships.
If you want to increase your chances of having what we would consider a successful engagement, it's imperative that you visualize what needs to happen.
God uses marriage to accomplish a very important goal - to help us become like Christ.
The Bible takes engagement very seriously, and for that reason we should too.
In modern Western culture, engagement is not a serious thing.
Many people today, particularly those of the youngest generations, are afraid of commitment. They don't want to be 'tied down.'
Most of us view engagement as a 'trial period,' a chance to 'test the waters' before plunging into the deep ocean of marriage.
As far as society is concerned, nothing is truly binding about engagement; nothing is really etched in stone.
Engagement is a worthy declaration to the public, church or society that the couple is planning to marry soon.
Courtship may come after engagement but it may differ in some cultures, churches, communities and etc.
Some people or cultures take engagement as marriage.
Christian marriage is an institution ordained by God for the long-term relationship between one man and one woman.
Start your marriage respecting each other so that people around you will respect you.
Falling in love with someone and finding out they want to spend the rest of their life with you is one of the most exhilarating of all human experiences.
Depending upon who you are and where you have been, each of you will have your own expectations about what love, romance, and marriage will look like.
No matter whom you date and eventually marry, every one is a flawed sinner-beginning with you.
Take time in pre-engagement or pre-marriage conversations to understand the balance of baggage and burdens vs blessings.
Every wedding day is different, and every individual faces it with fears, delusions, fantasies, doubts, excitement, joy, laughter, and even tears.
There is virtually nothing you can do that has more power to enhance your life than to build and protect a great and happy marriage.
The perfect marriage is a uniting of three persons--a man and a woman and God. That is what makes marriage holy.
Marriage is a holy bond because it permits two people to help each other work out their spiritual destinies. God declared marriage to be good.
Nothing brings more joy than a good marriage, and nothing brings more misery than a bad marriage.
First there's the promise ring, then the engagement ring, then the wedding ring..soon after..comes suffer..ing!
After marriage, husband and wife become two sides of a coin; they just can't face each other, but still they stay together.
Nowadays in other to reduce cost, engagement is done a day before the church wedding.
Often an engagement ring marking this obligation, is given by the man to his intended bride.
The ring not only signifies their intent to marry, but also publicly identifies the couple.
The engagement ring, on the fourth finger is a sign of promise and marriage commitment to someone who is very dear to your heart.
